label: Description
value:
A palace atrium in rocaille architecture is obliquely shown.  An elaborate urn stands upon a pedestal in its center.  Some standing women are slightly indicated.
Reverse: A small part of an ornament in graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, black chalk on paper

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Sarah and Eleanor Hewitt.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Erminia and Vafrino Tending the Wounded Tancred after the Battle of Argento [Tancrède secouru par Herminie et Vafrin après le combat d'Argante]

label: Description
value: A wounded soldier lying on the ground is assisted by a man wearing a turban (left) and a woman (right). The group is situated in a landscape, under a tree.  At right a horse is shown and in the foreground at left, lies a discarded shield.   A circular border is suggested implying that this composition was envisioned as a tondo.  See Curatorial Notes field.

label: Physical description
value: Red chalk on off-white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal format. Designs in the grotesque style. An exedra forms the central motif in which a woman with a dagger, probably "Tragedy," stands between two seated women; the left one holds a bloody bearded head, the right one plays a lyre. Two satyrs crouch at the outside.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and black, blue ink, brush and watercolor, gouache, gold paint, graphite on wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
"Saltarello Romano," Dancing Peasants In The Neighborhood of Rome

label: Description
value: A dancing pair with similar poses as in plate 1 of the "Raccolta" of 1809; but the boy has his hands akimbo, and the girl the right one. The tambourin is played by a girl, standing with a boy at right. A man and a woman are seated at left; a boy leans upon the legs of his father. Mountainous landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
"Saltarello Romano," Dancing Peasants In The Neighborhood Of Rome

label: Description
value: A boy in the pose of the dancer of plate 1, loc. cit., dances with a girl having the hands akimbo, at right. A group of girls with palm-like branches and a boy playing mandolin, are at left. One girl carries a hat upon her branch. Shown against the wall of a villa.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Vintage in the Mountains Near Rome

label: Description
value: The two standing girls, who are shown from the rear, plate 3, loc. cit., are shown in similar poses. Between them a seated boy receives a bunch of grapes from the left girl. The group ends with the girl at the outermost right in the etching, in a varied pose. The donkey is shown obliquely from the rear, at left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Five "Mozzatore," a young man and a boy dance. The pose of the main girl is a variation of that, plate 4, loc. cit. A group of girls in the central distance. Mountainous landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Description
value: A girl is seated upon, another leans against, a barrel, at left. Two seated girls in the center. A boy leaning upon a drinking donkey, at right. Mountain range in the rear.

value: A pair of girls with baskets pass a boy who sleeps in a seated position, on the rocks. A woman on a donkey rides backward, at left.

label: Description
value: Two boys play the mandolin, two more listen in poses similar to those of the one leaning against a stone and the seated one plate 6, loc. cit. The girl listens from a Romanesque twin window. Mountainous landscape.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Description
value: The bear and its leader are variations of the motif plate 7, loc. cit.; the bear holds a pole. A piper, two women and a child are at left, the woman with the terrified girl, the Capuchin, both similar to loc. cit., a woman with a baby is at right, a boy in the rear. The setting is a street of a place near Rome.

value: A little girl kisses the hand of a Hermit, the group being similar to plate 22, loc. cit. The women are standing by. Another and a boy watch, seated in the middle right distance. The setting represents the interior of the Colosseum.

A Family of Shepherds at Night

label: Description
value: A standing shepherd and a seated woman with a child on her lap, similar to plate 28, loc. cit., are connected by a sleeping boy and a seated man. The setting represents a circular wooden shed with a pointed roof.

Two Girls from Frascati Visit a Hermit

value: They stand at left, he is seated at right. The setting is reminiscent of plate 29, loc. cit.

A Peasant Family in the Campagna

label: Description
value: The group of grandmother, mother, and child, and the setting are similar to plate 31, loc. cit. The father watches leaning upon his staff.

Laundry in the Mountains Near Rome

label: Description
value: Two women are shown in profile, washing in a high basin; another carries a copper kettle; a fourth one approaches with a pitcher from the left.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and gray ink with watercolor and black chalk on off-white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
Costumes of Sorrento, Ischia, Procida, and Gaëta

label: Description
value: Four women, a man, and children in the dress of their respective regions. At left, woman shown walking and carrying a boy upon her right arm; another boy walks beside her: "Donna di Sorrento". In the center stand two women, the right one suckling a boy. The left one is a "Donna dell'Isola d'Ischia". Beside the right woman stand a man and a girl: "Uomo, e Donna di Procita". The man tries to sell a fish to a seated woman: "Donna di Gaëta". Framing lines.

label: Physical description
value: Black chalk, brush and watercolor on paper, mounted

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1931: acquired by Museum

Water color; Rinaldo Rinaldini is reciting upon the jetty

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A man is show [sic] standing upon the jetty and reciting from a book. His hat lies in front of him. He is surrounded by listeners forming a semicircle. The lighthouse is shown in the middle distance. Framing lines. Signature: "Gatta 1828."

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Two couples dance in the open to the music played by a man with a guitar and a woman with a tambourine. A woman with a baby is shown at right sitting in the middle distance at a slope. Mountainous country. Framing lines. Signature: "Gatta 1828."

value: Pen and black ink and water colors on paper.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A man riding upon a horse which carries luggage beside him, leads the front mule carrying with another a sedan chair in which a woman and a man sit. A driver with a long stick walks at right. A dog accompanies the caravans. In the background are the sea, Vesuvius and other mountains. Framing lines. Signature in the lower right corner: "1828/Gatta f."
